admission_criteria.overview: Admission is done through national-level entrance exams or based on qualifying exam marks. Minimum marks in qualifying exams are mandatory.

entrance_based.description: Admission via entrance exam with minimum qualifying marks.

non_entrance_based.description: Admission based on qualifying exam marks only.
programs: Advanced PG Diploma in Life Science Technology

nationality_age.nationality: Resident Indian (NRIs/OCI/PIO apply via international form)
nationality_age.age: At least 16 years and 6 months by July 31 of the year of 12th exam

qualifying_exam.requirement: 10+2 with Physics (mandatory), Mathematics (mandatory), and one of Chemistry/Biotechnology/Biology/CS/IT/IP/Engineering Graphics/Botany/Zoology
qualifying_exam.nios_note: Students must have completed 10th from regular schooling or vice-versa.
subject_notes: Students without Chemistry should undergo a bridge course.
Students without Mathematics in +2 (for Biotech/Genetic/Biomedical) must take 4-credit Math course in 1st year.

international.gce_a_level: Physics & Math mandatory + one of Chemistry/Biotech/Biology/CS/IT

barch.academic: 10+2 with 50% aggregate in Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics OR 10+3 Diploma with Math and 50% aggregate
barch.entrance: Qualify NATA or Council of Architecture Aptitude Test

mttech.general: Bachelor’s in relevant field with minimum 50% aggregate

specializations.Aerospace Engineering: B.E/B.Tech in Aerospace, Aeronautical, Mechanical, Automobile, Mechatronics, Production, Civil, Chemical, Instrumentation
specializations.Automotive Hybrid Systems: B.E/B. Tech in Mechanical, Automobile, Electrical, ECE, EEE, etc. (>50%). GATE or work experience preferred.
specializations.Biomedical Engineering: Four year Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, M.Sc Degree (or) MBBS / BPT / BOT (or) its equivalent
specializations.Biotechnology: B.E/B.Tech in Chemical, Biotech, B.Pharm, BS/M.Sc in Life Sciences
specializations.Chemical Engineering: B.E/B.Tech in Chemical, Petrochemical, Food, Biotech, or BS/M.Sc in Chemistry
specializations.Electronics and Control: B.E/B.Tech in ECE, EEE, ICE, EIE
specializations.Environmental Engineering: BE/B.Tech, B.Arch, M.Sc in Environmental Science, Chemistry, Ecology, etc.
specializations.Electric Vehicle Technology: B.E/B.Tech in Automobile, Mechanical, EEE, ECE, Mechatronics, or M.Sc Physics/Electronics
specializations.Genetic Engineering: B.E/B.Tech in Genetic/Biotech, B.Pharm, MBBS, BS/M.Sc in Life Sciences
specializations.Mechatronics: B.E/B.Tech in Mechanical, ECE, EEE, CSE, Mechatronics, etc.
specializations.Robotics: B.E/B.Tech in Mechanical, ECE, EEE, CSE, Mechatronics, etc.
specializations.Solar Energy: B.E/B.Tech in Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, Energy, or M.Sc (Physics, Material Science)
specializations.VLSI Design: B.E/B.Tech in ECE, EEE, CSE, IT or M.Sc (Electronics, Physics with Electronics)

march.academic: 50% aggregate in Bachelor of Architecture or equivalent
march.entrance: Qualify PG Entrance Test by Council of Architecture

mdes.academic: 50% aggregate in B.Des or B.Arch (4-year program)

btech.branch: Computer Science and Engineering w/s AI & ML
Computer Science and Engineering w/s Data Science
Computer Science and Engineering w/s Cyber Security
Computer Science and Engineering w/s AI & ML
Computer Science and Engineering w/s Data Science & AI

notes: One-time non-refundable registration fee: ₹10,000 or ₹15,000 depending on program.
Books & CDC fees applicable to Ramapuram, Vadapalani, and Trichy campuses.

application.how_to_apply: Apply online via SRM's application portal with e-payment.
instructions: Upload scanned photo (200x230 px) and signature (140x60 px).
After submission, save the application number.
Course/campus preference is statistical; final selection during counseling.

undergraduate.slots: 2 slots per day (bookable 2 days before exam)

documents_required: Entrance Exam Scorecard (SRMJEEE, NEET, CAT, etc.)

vision: To make students feel at home
To provide a friendly, comfortable, well-furnished, and secure ambiance
To foster a healthy, competitive, and culturally diverse learning environment
To inculcate discipline and strategic thinking

eligible: Full-time undergraduate, postgraduate, and research students
Students from Engineering, Medicine, Science, Management, Law
not_eligible: Part-time, evening, correspondence, or external course students

facilities: Healthy, sumptuous food at subsidized rates
North Indian, South Indian, Thai, Chinese, and Continental options
Gymnasium, playgrounds, indoor gaming (carrom, chess, table tennis)
